description: Visited yesterday, nice food, affordable pricing!!
author: Edward B.

description:
Oh yeah, Shanghai China and I knew each other. It was like a one-night stand that I immediately regretted and hoped in hindsight that it was all just a nightmare. But it wasn't. It was real. Over a decade ago. Before Grubhub. Before Eat24. Before DoorDash. Actually it wasn't that horrible, but I remember trying their diet special of Steamed Chicken with Vegetables, not the best idea for takeout since it was sitting in the delivery guy's car for quite some time before it got to me. Dried out and rubbery is what I remember.

Now I came back because I was looking for some lunch after a half-hearted workout at the gym and realized I had never actually been in the restaurant before. It was pretty sparse but frankly what I expected. I didn't order the Steamed Chicken with Vegetables but instead went for the $7.95 Eggplant with Garlic Sauce. It was drowning in the perennial brown sauce that always puzzled me at every low-end Chinese restaurant as to how the cook can achieve that particular shade of brown on a plate (photo: http://bit.ly/2s52WR1).

The white rice looked absolutely timid afraid to be overcome by the sauce. Because it was part of the lunch special menu, I got a cup of the Soup of the Day, which judging from the brownness of the broth, I was guessing it was the same soup they served the day before, maybe even the year before (photo: http://bit.ly/2rZulng). And of course, there was the obligatory deep-fried egg roll which I didn't touch. Yet for all that, it was not the same one-night stand from a decade ago. I mean my server didn't boil my pet rabbit in a stock pot. She was quite nice.

FOOD - 2 stars...a whole lotta brown
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...plain inside
SERVICE - 4 stars...no Glenn Close...she was pleasant
TOTAL - 2 stars...did I mention how brown that sauce was?
author: Ed U.

description:
I found one of my co-workers delivery menus and decided to check it out. Its your standard american style chinese takeout but great prices and huge portions. I ordered both the house special chicken fried rice and the fried wontons to barely put me over the 10 buck free delivery. 

I swear it was enough to feed 3 or 4 people. The wontons were freshly fried and very crispy but not much meat to speak of. At 4 bucks for a giant rack of them I cant complain tho. The fried rice had a solid blend of all the meats, egg, and veggies but while healthier i suppose was steamed instead of fried. I was in a greasy chinese takeout fried rice kinda mood but it wasnt bad and was a ton of food. 

Not bad but nothing to write home about. Great price for alot of food if your living on ice cube sandwiches till payday as well.
author: Sean G.

description:
Some if worst Sesame Chicken I've had in San Francisco. I expect a lot of breading, but I honestly couldn't find a single piece of chicken. Do not order!

Egg rolls arrived crispy, but lacked flavor.
author: Alan H.

description: For what it is, this place is insane. You can barely get a meal for under $10 in this damned city anymore, but this place serves it up hot and fresh every time. They deliver with lightning speed (protip: call them for no delivery fee) and the food is like it literally just came off the stove. I've always had good pieces of meat here, no mysteries. It's typical american chinese, but they also have some more interesting dishes if you branch out. I feel like it's disingenuous to complain about the type of food it is- if you want fancy, go to Yank Sing, or authentic, go to Taraval and 24th. For me, I'm glad this place exists and is close to my apartment.
author: Guinnevere C.

description: A Bit pricey, especially for a run down location, but I order there quite often for the delight of 3 soup. Pretty good and satisfies my craving.
author: Jaleesa A.

description: I really don't mean to disrespect here, but this food is so GROSS. The oil tastes rancid, gave us uncooked wontons, and under-fried egg rolls. How does the city of San Francisco not shut this place down? 0 stars!
author: Lauren A.

description: I've ordered delivery from here for years. Though I've tried a dozen dishes here, my go to has always been chicken with vegetables. It's light and delicious. But today on a whim I got chicken with eggplant. Wow! It's really well done. Definitely get it if you like eggplant. But don't order it too often as it IS quite oily.
author: Kristen S.

description: Delicious food, everything we ordered was fresh and prepare well, good flavor. We ordered via Grubhub. Driver was 10 minutes ahead of time, food was warm.
author: Joe V.

description:
Overall this place has gotten better. 
Quick tip: The Fried Won Tons only come with a crumb of meat (literally) and if you find a hair in tour foid take a picture of it before you point it out.
If you can handle that, they are not bad.
author: Tynesha B.

description: My favorite Chinese lunch spot downtown. The Mongolian Beef lunch special is delicious and I order it every time along with egg drop soup. Quick delivery when you don't want to leave your office. Also the price you can't beat along with the portions.
author: Karlson P.

description:
I wanted to try take out. I ordered beef with scramble egg over rice. One man quoted me $7.65. One lady quoted me $8.25. So, I paid $8.25. I was going to charge it and the minimum to use credit card is $9.00. The food came out quickly and I was on my way back to work.

Opened my take out bag which was bagged nicely. My beef and egg meal came with an soy sauce packet, egg roll, fortune cookie, napkins, and fork. The oyster sauce was a little skimpy on the beef and egg while the rice was plentiful. 

Overall, my take out meal was good. Yes, I would go back there for lunch. Yes, I would recommend this restaurant to my friends for a quick meal. I suggest you arrive early since u am assuming this place gets packed for lunch.
author: Larry W.

description: By far the best chow mein and chicken wings out there! Full of flavor, seriously. My family has been coming here since I was little, and this place never disappoints. We usually take it to go for family parties or even just a weekday night in at home when we don't feel like cooking. Sooo delicious!
author: Monica-Leah A.

description:
On this cold day I placed an order for a large, HOT order of combination wonton soup. EXCELLENT, that they delivered! The soup arrived in less than 30 mins, and the soup was steaming out. The meat, and shrimp were tender, and good veggies. 

I will place an order again.
author: Drew B.

description:
Seriously, DON'T eat here, have some self respect and believe your better than the food or service they provide. The owner is a liar and a thief! 

The owner tries to cheat people out of whatever he can on every order! I mean every time it's a discrepancy of $3-$7! Every time. Watch your ya and marvel at the gumption of the thieving owner. They repeatedly over charged us for things that their coupon claims to be free. Sadly, I have had food poisoning eating there on two occasions. 

On one occasion they over charged us and wouldn't resend burnt food but we thought maybe it was just the crew working and ordered delivery again. BAD IDEA! regretted it completely. I will file a complaint with the health department due to the gastrointestinal distress this placed has caused me and my family, the city due to the habitual cheating and over charging and of course the Better Business Bureau. 

NEVER EAT HERE! 

Order Red Jade on Church and market, their food is way better doesn't get you sick and they don't try to steal or cheat you every time you go in.
author: S8adow M.

description: Eww, they gave me the wrong order even though I could see the online order form on mine. When I pointed it out she dismisses me and shoves a bag at me. I wound up with a shiny mess of king pow instead of schezuan. The egg roll was soggy and out of the box. Sauce was mostly sugar BLECH!!!!
author: Tommy S.

description: Really?! I mean, really?! First thing I see when I open my order. Right on top. Deep fried spider. Are you all totally f-ing blind?! Damn thing was stuck to the dumpling and had gone through the fryer too. I hope the other customers today enjoy their meal as much as this. Copy of this to the health department and entire meal in the trash.
author: Andy T.

description: This restaurant is seriously so good! Some may be deterred by the appearance and location of this place, but if the food is delicious (which it is), then who cares? I always get takeout from here and the portion sizes are pretty big, especially for the price point. The service is really nice (free tea while I wait for my takeout), and the owners are also great people. My favorites to order are the tomato beef chow mein and orange chicken. Yum!
author: Michelle M.

description: These people need to really read & follow directions on orders. I constantly ORDER from them & they constantly get my order wrong even after I offered to pay extra for 6 CUPS OF SWEET AND SOUR SAUCE WITH ORDER instead of 3.
author: Marvin H.

description: Good and cheap Chinese food, beef or veggie chow mein, black bean and fish are my favorites but that's about it. Go to place when I want those dishes..
author: M I.

description: The food is great, fast and very friendly. I come here for lunch as it's just down the street. If you are on the run and need something quick, this is a gem!
author: Larry A.

description:
Best value for money for a lunch from office.

Fast, good comfort food, great taste, huge portions and serves free soup, which is actually tasty.

This has been a go to place for me, even though if you time is wrong during lunch, seating would be difficult. So, for a group larger than 4 I would say check in a bit early for lunch. Ambience isn't great but then you can't expect a lot for $6.50-$7.50 a meal. 

The food on the other hand is very tasty, and almost all the dishes I tried they come with a lot of veggies. However there is a downside for some Chow mein and fried rice, since they are oily, but then again, which kind of Chinese here isn't.

My go to is spicy beef, pork and chickens over rice which balances the oil and you can still have the taste. Comes with spring rolls.

The schezwan beef comes with peanuts and not too spicy, which kind of was a surprise for me. The Mongolian beef over rice is awesome and again not spicy. Pork chow meins are good too.

Overall great cheap delicious food for lunch on any day.
author: Himadri Shekhar K.

description:
I've been here a few times with slightly below average experiences (its close and convenient), but my experience today was JUST PLAIN BAD! 

I ordered boiled white rice online (already paid for) to prevent having to wait long. When I arrived, there was a short line of 2 people. Shortly after I stood in line, some random guy cuts us all and begins to order his food. Mind you, the 2 other people and I were waiting in line for a few minutes (even stopped 2 waiters to ask if we could order since no one was near the register and was told to wait).  I asked the waitress why she skipped us (ignored me) and she continued to take his order. 

But wait... there's more! While this waitress takes the cutter's order, another waitress starts helping people at the end of the line (these people came in AFTER we did) and taking their orders. By this point I was pretty irritated (its plain boiled rice that I already paid for and now I have to wait while you help people that came in after me?). 

Needless to say, I won't be back.   I'll save my little $1.50 so I don't have to wait 15-20 minutes for plain boiled rice
author: Roslyn H.

description:
I usually go to this place when I'm feeling for some Chinese food while I'm work. It's not the best, but for the price and portions and location its not too bad. I usually order the Chicken Chow Mein or the Shanghai Rice Cake w/ chicken . 

The portions are super huge so its enough to actually share with another person. Its a hit or miss, some days its salty, some days its bland, and some days its made just right. I always had hot sauce to it, so it makes everything taste pretty good. They do delivery and online order and pick up. It's so much easier to do that but I would always check your order before you leave. There were a few times I've requested certain things, and they simple just dont' look at the extra comments being made. 

Delivery is quick and easy,since there are times I'm at the office and its too busy I don't have time to go out and pick up. I have to say they do get really busy especially other companies are around and people go there to eat. I've ordered once in the restaurant and it took forever to just get my food. 

I've also tried their wonton noodle soup, it was really salty the first two times buying git. And the soup base was very dark almost as if a lot of soy sauce was added to the soup base. 

All in all its not super expensive and you pay for what you get. Service is sometimes good and sometimes bad depending on the day. I get it gets busy but sometimes they just simple ignore you when your standing there trying to get some service.
author: Tiffany K.

description: I've lived within a block of this place for over a year, and always avoided it because it has short hours and looks empty all the time. Turns out that is for a reason. I got General Chicken, and it was $10 with no rice. The batter was mushy, the chicken really poor quality, and it barely came out hot.
author: Kurt N.

description: They need to advertise to use cared it's a $9 minimum, never of a amount like that. This place is stupid packed at this time. Best to call in an pick up, ( remember it's a $9 minimum to use card
author: Nicole G.

description: I got takeout here, both dishes I got were far too sweet -- ended up throwing them away, which hardly ever happens. Dumplings were OK at least.
author: Mike T.

description: Every plate is a winner!!!! Delivery is lightening FAST. Always under 30 minutes. Food is hot and delicious. I don't know how they keep it so inexpensive. Great job Shanghai China!!!!!
author: Hector M.

description: Awful...just awful. I ordered the Generals Chicken. It was just 6 large balls of deep fried chicken in a garlic sauce. The egg flower soup was so bland. If your order is under $9 there is a $0.35 fee.
author: Angie C.

description: We are in SF for the weekend and we were starving but didn't feel like going out bc we wanted to rest first. So we ordered from here and our experience was pleasant. Delivery was free  (over $10), and the delivery was made before the approximate time they gave me. They even came all the way up to my room at the hotel to bring it. We had the Beef Chow Mein and shrimp broccoli. It did not disappoint. It was enough for 2 people for about $20 or so...
author: Crystal E.

description: 5 stars for a very rarely seen entree in most American Asian restaurant: bitter melon beef rice! The item is not on the menu but you could order it from the waitress :)
author: Eva F.

description:
Their chicken fried rice is decent, goid flavors in their.
I had Yu Hsiang Chicken curry which was supposed to be spicy but it wasnt. Their spring rolls were good.
Their one order of fried rice or curry is sufficient for two to three people and its cheap for San Francisco.
author: Nikhila P.

description: Great price and good food. The house special rice is good plus the war won ton soup was delicious.
author: Alberto G.

description: While this might not be the type of place you rate as a 5 star here is why I think it deserves it. The lunch special is a very fair value.  If you dine in you get soup tea and an  orange slice. I ordered to go, but while I waited they served me tea which was spot on. My dish was goo. I ordered the fried rice it was tasty and the portion generous. Though I wish it had been packaged in a classic Chinese container instead of the plastic tray. I will definitely come back
author: Teresa W.

description: Cheap and easy food. Very good food. Had the crispy noodles. It was well seasoned and I'd like to come back. Only down side is the front door kept blowing open and it was a bit cold.
author: Jm C.

description:
Our first time ordering from Shanghai, China.  The food is good, just as I expected for a standard Chinese Restaurant.  The portion size for the rice plate lunch's we ordered was filling, and there were leftovers.  The Garlick Chicken wings became an immediate favorite.  My only complaint was about the ordering process.  It seems that their Website Menu has not had it's prices adjusted for 5+ years, or so I was told by the owner.  We had questions because it was our first order, so we called using the Menu for our ordering.  When it was delivered the bill was 25% higher than I expected.  I called for clarification, and was told that the online menu hadn't been updated in years, but If I look at the online ordering tab, that does have the correct prices.   So I suggest that anyone ordering by phone, ask for their current price fo the items being ordered.  One other piece of info,  Not all the Items shown on the menu appear in the online order tab.  Primarily, the lunch rice plates I order by phone I wouldn't have been able to order online.

All in all, be aware of the inaccuracy of prices, & discrepancy of dishes available, when you order. I recommend this restaurant for delivery.  I will surely patronize them, again.  The food is worth it!!
author: P.I. M.

description: They are ok in a pinch.  But the Twice Cooked Pork and Fried Chicken Wings are amazing!!!
author: Terri C.

description: Just based on generals chicken, balls of unidentifiable chicken meats, dipped in lumpy batter, fried not quite crispy but also with hard pebbles of flour. Perhaps I have high standards based on some amazing generals chicken in the past. The service was quick and the price was cheapest food around for a sit down meal in this area so kept the rating a 3. Will have try the Mongolian beef or the broccoli beef which was mentioned in other reviews before adding or subtracting stars.
author: tomohisa w.

description:
I didn't choose to eat here but my co worker urged me to. Once I seen the restroom, I was set.

Sounds a bit weird to base my review on the restroom inside the restaurant, but I have my reasons. Typically when eating out in an Chinese food place, the restroom is disgusting. Which makes me think of how clean and sanitized it is in the kitchen. When I used the restroom, it was very clean. There wasn't an old smelly mop on the side, with questionable puddles covering the floor. It was well lit and clean. Now I'm happy to try the food. Mongolian beef was great! Wish it was a bit spicier. But I had no complaints leaving. Also the roast beef w tofu on stir fry. Beautiful. I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Johnny C.

description: Consistently good, reasonably priced Chinese food. Quick and friendly service. Great neighborhood place!
author: Lara H.

description:
I have to admit that I have ordered from here more times than I would care to admit.

So, let's start with the bad. The bad part about this restaurant is that I've had an experience buying fried rice in which it bordered on the hint of burnt-ness, as in on the border of edible and slightly tinged. I have had this experience maybe seven percent of the time?  (one in fifteen, give me a break!).

On to the good parts!
At a beautiful $10 min order with free shipping from Eat24, this place is high on my top-tier list for cheap chinese food eats.

The mongolian beef is, or at least was, one of the top things I order. Although not very spicy, it is always easy to add your own sriracha when they deliver it to your door!

Other than that, their curry chicken definitely is in the top three of delivery curry chicken places that I have tried. I also have had good experiences with the hunan sliced pork!

Their chow mein and fried rice are (despite the one experience) quite good and I definitely prefer them to many of the other restaurants in the area.
author: Alexander L.

description: Seriously hating myself after eating the general chicken lunch special. Food was mediocre and the service was as well. Sorry to say but Panda Express is better. Only plus I can think of is the amount of food you get for the money you pay.
author: Claudia G.

description:
I ordered online through Grubhub. I have to say, they came much sooner than the estimated time! I had the egg flower soup, the orange chicken, and the potstickers. Potstickers were ok. I liked the soup and the chicken. They actually put the hot sauce for the chicken in separate containers which was nice. Everything was so nice and warm, too!

I'll order again soon :)
author: Sky L.

description: The food here is really delicious and plentiful. I always order Mongolian beef chow, wonderful flavors. Great soup and tea free when you dine in. Yummers!!!!
author: Gwen H.

description: Pretty standard and a bit flavorless. I enjoy cheap Chinese food but this was okay. Vegetable Tempura was strange...huge portion but 80% potato and no proper sauce.
author: Jason G.

description: The staff at this place was the worst I've ever experienced in my life. No 1 that works and this place has any customer service training and no people skills. The lady that came to take the order was rude as hell. She took a long time to get us a simple glass of water a was mumbling things under her breath, on top of that the food was gross Panda Express food is better then the garbage they served us.
author: Kimora C.

description:
One of few Chinese restaurants around work. A pretty divvy place with good proportions, if I were. Detective I would probably frequent this place with my partner to talk about the case.

But I'm not, so I come here to talk shop on non-work interests. Definitely a regular's spot.
author: Christophe C.

description:
Solid place to get Chinese food. The interior is very simple yet effective. For lunch, the menu is kept very minimal with dishes not going over 7 bucks. When you're seated, you get a pot of tea and are greeted with a piece of paper indicating different zodiac animals.

The decided to get the broccoli and beef with rice and my gf decided on a beef stew noodle with wontons which was a bit extra seeing as the three combination weren't on the menu. Both dishes were excellent in ask regards although the broccoli beef could lay off on the amount of sauce. By the end of the plate, there was still a small puddle when usually the rice soaks up the sauce.

Service could be miles better. When we ordered our food and questions about the noodle dish, the waiter assumed that we weren't going to get it when we specifically asked to be made like that. One dish for two people just doesn't make much sense.

Overall, solid place to grab lunch, but double check with the waiter on your order.
author: George Z.

description:
Do not come here expecting a 5 star experience. I live close to Shanghai China and it's one of those go-to spots when you're in a pinch and just want some potstickers, a green onion pancake, or plain fried rice (can you tell these are my usuals?). 

I also order their won ton soup and it's pretty good. Not a fan of their hot and sour soup or black bean spare ribs. BF loves their Mongolian beef. I hear they have sweet lunch deals but I'm never home to partake.

Service is quick and fairly attentive. Ambiance and decor is nothing to write home or Yelp about. They offer free delivery as well which is a plus for some people. Another plus: you can order via EAT24 for hassle-free ordering.
author: Johanna L.

description:
Combination fried rice needed more seasoning.
Chicken wings were bland and seemed to be only cooked in grease and garlic.
Not a fan. Should of took my lazy self else where.
But for cheap, quick lunch I guess its ok
author: Ayana K.

description: The only positive thing I can say about this outfit was the delivery arrived before the estimated time. The food was horrible. Szechuan Beef was bland and was 95% vegetables. The Cold Noodles were hot and now that they have cooled in the refer overnight they are like eating paste. I salvaged one dish, the other one went in the trash. Don't waste your money. There must be someone in this city who can put out good food and then bring it to you; but I can't find them. Undoubtedly one of the worst experiences I have had with Seamless. The other issue I have is the "Delivery Charge". On Seamless they rack you $3. On Grub Hub it's free. On the menu it's $2 if the order is under $10. On the front of the brick and mortar it's free. These are some scandalous dudes with no culinary skills.
author: Richard L. D.

description:
For the 4 months of weekend work I had to do at Goodwill for a traffic violation that I will not mention here, I ate at Shanghai China Restaurant nearly every Saturday since it's located right across from the 1500 Goodwill building. During the time I came here, I never ordered anything other than their Wonton soup as I'm an avid wonton soup fan. They were so quick to serve their yummilicious wonton soup that the stingy 30 minute lunch break was an adequate amount of time for me to eat, sit, and have a cigarette after! The wonton soup is reasonably priced and comes with bbq pork, chicken, vegetables, shrimp, the works. The broth is super tasty and great on a cold day. The wontons themselves were plump and yummy and satisfied any trace of a hangover on a Saturday after partying on a Friday and having to slave labor over at Goodwill the day after.

4 stars for quick service and tasty bites! Recommend!
author: Annie C.

description:
This is a review of delivery from Shanghai China Restaurant.

It is easy to order from http://eat24hours.com/.

Delivery - The order was placed at 2:35 PM.   The order was delivered at 3:35 PM.  The estimated time for delivery was 45-60 minutes.  Delivery was prompt but not particularly fast.  There is no delivery fee.  The delivery person was polite.

Order Minimum - It is very low ($10)

Mandarin Spicy Chicken - Even thought the dish has the word spicy in the title and I selected the Hot option, there was nothing spicy about it.  It was bland, bland, bland.  They also did NOT include the side of hot sauce that was requested.  If you like broccoli, they did include a ton of very fresh broccoli.   

Mongolian Beef -  This is another dish that is traditionally spicy and I selected Hot.  But, it was also bland, bland, bland.   I have no idea what you get if you select mild.  Once again, they did NOT include the requested side of hot sauce. The meat was tender but was quite oily.  The veggies were crisp but it was basically just onions.

Boiled Rice - The rice was good.  I ordered and paid for two orders.  However, I only received one small container.  I can't imagine that two orders of rice could be squeezed into that small of a container.

Packing - The food was neatly packed in a combination of clam-shell and traditional Chinese take-out containers.

7-Up - I ordered and paid for 3 7-Ups.  I only received one and it was room temperature.

Pricing -  I would place their prices on the mid to high range for Chinese food delivery.

Mandarin Spicy Chicken 1 $7.50 Make it : Hot
Instructions: side of hot sauce please

Mongolian Beef 1 $7.95 Make it : Hot
Instructions: side of hot sauce please

http://tinyurl.com/3nl5c54

Can Soda 3 $1.25 Flavor: 7UP

Boiled Rice (For One) 2 $0.95

Subtotal: $21.10 
Tax: $1.79 
Total:   $22.89 

Fortune Cookie - Now is the best time for you to be spontaneous.  Serendipity!

Lucky Numbers - This was some kind of budget fortune cookie.  It did not have any lucky numbers.  They could only afford the fortune.

Overall - Bland food.  Delivery that is not particularly fast. So so prices. Inaccuracies on the order.  No lucky numbers.  I would not rate it as one of my top experiences. Their low minimum delivery fee would make them a money saving option for ordering for one.
author: Mark D.

description: Ordered the shrimp fried rice. Got a pile of burnt rice with maybe four tiny prawns thrown in.
author: Amitabho C.

description:
First of all, we're part of the aforementioned government workers who frequent this place.  

We came for lunch.  Service was rude & gruff.  I asked if my shrimp chow fun had broccoli, which I love, and received a sarcastic bark in reply.  I let it go.  

On to the food: Greasy.  You'll make it to your next paycheck courtesy of the taxpayers but if you eat at Shanghai China on a regular basis kiss your government pension goodbye.  (Taxpayers cheer.)  

When it came time for the bill, we payed with a pile of cash and a credit card.  Apparently, this dual-payment method was too much for the waitress.  Confusion ensued behind the counter and before we could finish the last drops of green tea to clear our arteries the entire staff, including the "chef," were staring down at us, making comments amongst themselves in some far-Eastern dialect.

Although we asked if there was an issue, the replies were, uh, inscrutable.  Eventually, we were able to surmise that the Shanghai China staff thought we left no tip.  On the contrary, we left an appropriate -- considering the service -- 10 percent.  "Americans leave tip," the waitress scolded.  In frustration, and perhaps with an overriding desire to make it back to his wife & kid in one piece, a coworker threw down an extra $5 to get us the hell out of there.       

I call on all public employees to boycott this dump and leave it the likes of Google & Facebook who, rumor has it, will soon be in the neighborhood...
author: Paul D.

description:
This is the only no-fail hangover cure I know of. Water, aspirin, Gatorade, rest, tea, hair of the dog - ain't got shit on Shanghai China.

Maybe I would think differently if I actually stepped inside but who really dines in at a place like this?

Delivery is fast.

Five stars.
author: Jenny P.

description:
I've been ordering from this place for 5 years now and I've never been let down .. except the time I tried the Shrimp and Lobster Sauce. They deliver FAST. Sometimes as fast at 25 minutes. The guy who delivers is super awesome, the food is cheap and tasty. What more could you ask for? Sure, it's not fine dining froo-froo Chinese food, with your little California slice of avocado on the side, and a glass of Navarro to wash it down. No, it's greasy Mission Chinese food, and I think you will enjoy it. Don't listen to the haters :)

My personal two favorite orders:

Delight of 3 (Chicken, Beef and Shrimp) & Steamed Rice with a Wor Wonton Soup
Sweet and Sour Chicken with Egg Drop Soup
author: Billy K.

description:
Never had such horrible Chinese food before: Absolutely Disgusting!!!  First, their wontons tasted like spoiled eggs...I literally GAGGED!!!  Then, let's talk about their shrimps...they were mushy and definitely NOT FRESH at all.  How did they make the chicken meat so slimy?!!  The texture of the meat was WEIRD!!!  If I get food poisoning tomorrow, I will report them for sure.  I have this strange aftertaste in my mouth and it's upsetting.  I even expressed my concerns to the waiter but he just brushed me off like he could careless, sighs!!!

I highly questioned those who gave them 5 stars...very suspicious.  Warning the rest of the Yelpers!!!
author: Ray C.

description: Homey chinese restaurant owned by Shanghainese family. They probably shudder at all the Americanized food the clientele orders but whatever the customer wants they get. They make everything pretty well but especially rice cake dishes. There are more authentic offerings but with the clientele, it's not on the menu.
author: Rrr X.

description: This one of those stereotypical Chinese sit down / fast food establishments that's cheap, quick, and easy. It comes in generous portions, which lasts me one and a half meals. You can't go wrong with the chow mein, chow fun, and fried rice. I didn't like the Singapore noodles that much though, maybe too much noodle and too few accompaniments? As with many tucked away restaurants, it's a little grubby and homely. The tea is watered down too. Service is fast and you are guaranteed a good fortune with your fortune cookie. Ordering online is easy. They even do delivery with a $10 minimum. Credit cards accepted.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Definitely the worst Chinese food my coworkers and I have ever eaten. I feel bad leaving less than stellar reviews, but I just feel like people should be warned. I spent about $30 and had about 3 bites of food. It was just too nasty to finish. No flavor, slimey and just all-around bad. I gave them 2 stars because their potstickers were OK.
author: Stef S.

description: I love the salt and pepper pork chop. Super tasty..perfect with white rice!
author: Leslie M.

description: I ordered this on EAT24.com cause I had lots of work on my desk and didn't want to leave and within 20 minutes food was here hot and fresh. The Pot stickers had been fresh and warm and the hot and sour soup was exactly what I needed. I wish they added some chicken to it but I will have to add to it next time. The soup was spicy, just how I like it. I will be getting to go again soon. Great job to the delivery guy who got the location right on the first try ;) That's a $5 tip in its self.
author: Jess C.

description: General's chicken is like they put the sauce on KFC extra crispy nuggets. Order something else. And neither of us had a fortune in our cookie!
author: Richard A.

description:
I was having a go-through-clothes-in-my-storage-unit-and-donate-what-I'm-too-fat-for afternoon and stopped in for a quick, cheap lunch.

I grew in SoCal eating Chinese food nearly every day and have conceded that even the worst place in the San Gabriel Valley would be pretty good in SF and the best of SF would be at best mediocre in the SGV. But after work weeks of salads and sandwiches, I sometimes just swallow the inevitable disappointment and just eat Chinese in SF.

You walk in and it's pretty clean for a cheap Chinese restaurant. I don't know if it's because they weren't too busy or because I'm Chinese and impressed them by ordering in Mandarin or just because but I was greeted, seated and served tea immediately. I ordered a lunch special and was given a bowl of hot and sour soup.

Hot and sour soup: not the best I had but definitely not the worst. It's not watery but the flavors didn't have the complexity I've tasted in better versions. All in all, it was loaded with goodies and left a pleasantly burn of spice in my mouth.

Yu Hsiang eggplant: the portion is massive. I order this 50% of the time when I eat Chinese and this wasnt so bad. I don't know that I would come back just to have it but I was able to eat a good amount. It wasn't very spicy though adding chili oil helped there and the flavor was decent. The eggplant was at least marinated in the sauce. Again not the best but not the worst. Especially good for SF since my total was $6 and Chinese food in the city is almost always overpriced (and what's up with being closed on holidays and/or one day out of the week? Chinese restaurants in LA wouldn't do that.)

The service was pretty good. They weren't overly attentive but I also didnt need much. 

If you're looking for delicious authentic Chinese food, you're looking in the wrong city. Try South Bay. You can tell this place isn't one because the table settings feature forks (not chopsticks) and its called "Shanghai China Restaurant" yet doesn't serve xiao long baos and is missing other trademark Shanghainese dishes. Also the fortune cookies. 

If you like typical Americanized Chinese fare that is on par to the rest of the Chinese restaurants in San Francisco, I don't think you'll be especially disappointed.
author: K C.

description: I ordered the crispy mandarin shrimp and broccoli dinner entree  and in the instructions on Grubhub I asked for white rice instead of fried rice. The meal was delivered without any rice. I called to tell them I was missing my rice. I was rudely told if I wanted rice I would have to pay for it. I asked if they had seen my request on the order. He said it didn't matter, I didn't actually order rice and pay for rice. I explained that I assumed the dinner entrees included rice...he said they don't. I suggested they could have called me and asked if I wanted to order it. No apology, nothing or an attempt to sell me rice. By the way the shrimp was tasteless and extremely soggy and the broccoli was totally overlooked.
author: Charlotte R.

description: Busy lunch place with extra starchy soups and sauces in their dishes.  Food isn't traditional but edible for what it is.  Medium to high levels of MSG.
author: L T.

description:
Quick, fast, filling place for lunch. You can get away with $7 for a lunch entree and a soda and still have leftovers for your afternoon snack.

Order from the chowmein lunch menu and get the beef fun dish. Filled me up fast. But they also have beef, chicken and pork specials too. All under $6 and that extra buck for the soda. 

They have a chili oil that packs a good punch for that right flavor. If you're getting it to go, make sure you have a stock of Sirachia sauce awaiting.
author: Christopher V.

description: great food reasonable prices yessss
author: Nichelle S.

description:
If you don't feel like spending a whole lot and you feel like eating the same leftovers for an entire week, this is the restaurant for you! I work nearby and it's very convenient, but I seem to regret it every time I go.

I come here for lunch for the following reasons:
- Very cheap
- Quick service (You'll be in and out in 30 minutes)

The reasons why I regret eating here:
- Too much food (This could be a good thing depending the person, but for me it's a bad thing)
- Rude employees (About 15 seconds of you sitting down, they come up to you and ask if you're ready to order. If you're not ready they give you a 
dirty look as they walk away)
- Most of their dishes has a lot of sauce that makes the entire dish soggy
- After eating their food  I get a stomach ache

I've ordered the following dishes(all of which gave me a stomach ache):
- Hot and Sour soup (You could swim in their bowl)
- Sweet and Sour Pork (This is my favorite dish here mainly because it has the least sauce)
- Mongolian Beef
- General Chicken

I will continue to come here to save money, but only if I've exhausted all my other options.
author: Therese M.

description:
I picked up a take out menue on a Monday and placed a phone prder for delivery the very next day. On the to go menu there is a coupon that states "Free fried rice or Chow Mein with order of $20 or more with eat in, pick up or delivery with coupon only, coupons can not be combined" and "coupon not good for lunch special".

I ordered 3 items not on the lunch menu that totaled over $20 INCLUDING taxes. The lady over the phone said the coupon is not valid, the order has to total $20 before taxes. I told her the coupon did not say that but since that is the rule I will use the other coupon on the menu. "Free friend wontons or potsticker or spring roll Delivery Order, free, fast, hot delivery. $15 Minimum for delivery with coupon only. Coupons can not be combined." The lady over the phone then said, "that coupon is expired". 

So what's the point of advertising if you're not going to honnor the coupons?

On the plus side, the Garlic Chicken was good.
author: Christina L.

description:
Big portions, cheap, the food is cooked well and the delivery is very prompt. 

Some of the dishes could use more flavor, but they are always properly prepared.
author: Nicki H.

description:
I used to love Shanghai China Restaurant. Even after we moved out of the neighborhood, we kept ordering delivery from them.

This evening when we got our wonton soup, we dished it out and... I found a dead caterpillar floating in my bok choy.

When we called them about it, they insisted that it must be a fried onion. Despite the fact that it's green and white, segmented, and has legs.

I'm... I'm never ordering from them again.
author: Linda V.

description:
I ate here recently and the food was ok. What really pissed me off was that they swiped my credit card twice and charged me TWICE! I gave them over 20% tip and that's how they treat me. They informed me that they may have swiped my card twice and that if there was a mistake, they told me to come back here the next day. 

I'm only there for one day training and there's no way I'll be coming back here to eat cause they made the stupid mistake of swiping my card twice. Now I'm disputing the charges with my credit card company. Be aware to check your bank statements online cause they might swipe your card twice too!
author: unknown u.

description: We placed our order through EAT24...First mistake...when I order came I realized that I had been charged for what was stated on the receipt as "free". I was then asked by the delivery person to call the manager "Kenny". When I called I was told he wasn't there and "Kenny" hung up the phone. When the driver called and put me on the phone, "Kenny" then proceeded to yell at me!!! RUDE...I refuse to be treated this way by anyone and especially a mediocre food joint!
author: Noree B.

description: I love all things Asian, but Chinese is probably my least favorite of Asian cuisines. Unless it's made with attached heads, attached feet, gizzards, innards, and other various animal body parts that most Americans wouldn't dare touch, it doesn't really excite me. This is why it's so difficult for me to review a Chinese restaurant. I don't hate the food, but I'm never that excited about it either. Compared to the flavor slappings of Thai and Vietnamese food, Chinese food is kinda blah. The service was friendly and the food was fresh. I'll give them that. I didn't love my food, but I still enjoyed my meal. Mom liked her experience (far more than I did) so I may have to take her back.
author: Helen L.

description: Excellent. I ordered this while at work last night and it was incredible. Their Orange Flavored Chicken was possibly the best I've ever had. Delivered in 28 minutes, price wasn't bad. $15, Enough for two meals.
author: Rob B.

description: Delicious. Our food came out within five minutes of ordering, it was definitely freshly made and prepared. The generals chicken was deep fried all white chicken drenched in sauce. will be back.
author: Emily G.

description:
Build a Chinese Restaurant in the slums and THEY WILL COME. Even if you serve tasteless, almost inedible food with rude service, THEY WILL COME! Why? Because people have no where to go but here, THAT'S WHY!

Shanghai China is a block away from the office and although it's NOT as bad as Iron Wok, it's STILL bad nevertheless. It's one of those, "Damn it, I didn't bring lunch to work and it's my last resort type of thing without having to go too far."

I've been here 3 times and have tried the following:

FOOD:
*Mu Shu Pork: A stir fry combo of sliced pork, egg, cabbage, wooden ears fungi, bamboo shoots, carrots, and onions. The veggies were overcooked and mushy esp the cabbage which should have stayed naturally stayed a bit al-dente. The pork was suppose to be sliced in strips but were cut 90% down the way, so multiple strips stuck together. The dish is quite salty from the MSG, soy sauce, and oyster. So, if you're MSG sensitive like me, expect to get headaches soon after and make multiple trips to the water cooler throughout the day. The 5 crepes provided are cracking b/c they're so dry. They're thrown on top of the carton without wrapping it. :X

*Beef Stew Wonton Noodle Soup: Awful! The beef stew was hard, dry, and flavorless. The wonton aka wrapped meatball was horrendous; the center was hard which was obvious it's been frozen for a LONG time. It was overcooked to the point the edges of the wrapper had sloughed off and intertwined with the overcooked, soggy noodles. And, the bok choy is also overcooked, mushy, and no longer a vibrant green color. The broth is MSG laden probably b/c it was made from beef bouillon cubes.

*Steamed Chicken and Veggies (from Special Diet Menu): Do NOT, I repeat, do NOT order anything from their diet menu. The dish consists of several slices of white meat chicken and frozen veggies (carrots, snap peas, baby corn, bamboo shoots). The chicken is DRY and tasteless and the veggies are overcooked and mushy. They don't cook it in oil or season it, so it literally taste like rabbit food. If that's their interpretation of "diet food" no wonder 95% of diets FAIL.

SERVICE: 
I've eaten here once and the waitresses are rude and inattentive which is why I've done To-Go orders thereafter. You have to ask them multiple times if you want something. But, worse of all, the waitresses speak in Canto about customers as if they don't understand. When my co-worker and I were sitting down waiting for the menus, another table had freed up, and one of the waitresses wanted us to automatically assume to know to move to that table. She then said in Canto, "Those girls are stupid for not moving and wanting to sit in the middle table when they can have the corner one." WTF?!?!? How in the hell were we suppose to know she wanted us to move when she never asked? ESP??? I'm use to abuse in Asian restaurants, so although it slightly pissed by off, I quickly rubbed it off. However, they should really be mindful of what they say because you never know who will understand them. 

Perhaps, I should use my BB calendar more often, so I can avoid those "Damn it" moments where I have to resort to coming here...
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Ordered delivery from here.  There was a coupon for free fried rice or chow mein with an order over a certain amount.  It was somewhere between $20 and $30.  

I don't remember exactly what I had but I'm sure it was a chicken, a seafood and a noodle.  The food was delivered in about 30 minutes and everything tasted fine.  I'd order from them again.
author: Seong P.

description:
Was looking for a Chinese restaurant with a menu featuring more traditional Chinese food (not the typical Americanized sweet and sour something, etc) and would deliver to me at my new place in Hayes Valley.  

Ordered through eat24hours and the confirmation email said 45-60 minutes.  Food arrived very warm 48 minutes later.  Nice.  Free delivery min was only $10.  Double nice.  

Unfortunately, very not impressed with what I got.  Tried the Yu Hsiang Eggplant in Garlic Sauce and Family Style Bean Curd.  They tasted fairly similar.  The pork had a suspicious flavor and texture.   The eggplant was so overcooked it was almost eggplant puree.

I eat Chinese food a lot.  It's not uncommon for the boyf (who is from HK) and me to eat it 4-5 times a week.  But tonight, when I put nearly all of my dinner in the fridge as left-overs, I actually thought "I wonder if I'll eat any more of this before it goes bad."
author: Amanda D.

description:
had to get a car wash and wax across the street today. so to quench the post spin class hunger pangs, an order of chicken with bean sprouts crispy fried noodles.  the chicken and sprouts had good flavor and heat but the noodles were all wrong. first off they were too thick to deep fry and after the gravy hits them the noodles should soften up a bit. not this kind. the proper noodle is a fresh egg noodle. thinner than what was used here. 
 i should have just stuck with the basic chicken chow mein and called it the day. they spoke cantonese here so i incorrectly assumed that they could cook Cantonese/Hong Kong style dishes here.
author: Jeff W.

description: I would give a zero if I could.  What a waste of 22 bucks?  I'm not a cook but I'm sure I can make better tasting food than this.
author: Pres L.

description: Had it delivered. Bit into a FINGER NAIL CLIPPING. Will never ever ever ever EVER order again.
author: Eric W.

description: I have been frequenting thsi place for like 6 months and the service is always super rude but, its right near my job and cheap so I overlook it.  Yesterday a MOUSE ran out of the kitchen and the staff just shooed it away and acted liek business as usual...DONE WITH THIS PLACE
author: Terye L.

description: Standard Chinese food fair that won't surprise you.  Their lunch special is very standard and afforable.  It does come in slightly salty and oily side but if you are around the area and need some quick chinese food.  I would go inside and take a look.
author: Aaron L.

description:
My husband and I only spent $15 total on dinner.  We ordered two items (vegetarian chow mein and spicy eggplant).  The veg chow mein was pretty good...and I get really excited when I can get chow mein without beef broth in it.  The spicy eggplant was bland and kind of weird.

We went with a large group, and my feeling is that the menu items are hit and miss.  There are a number of items that are quite good and a lot of things that are horrible.  If you knew what would be good, you could get a big dinner for the price of McDonald's.

...and the restroom is pretty clean.  That's always a plus in my book.
author: PrincessPeac H.

description:
The food continues to be decent.  The fortune cookie fortunes continue to be very problematic.  My two from tonight:

"You will always be surrounded by true friends."

"Approach all areas of life with a bold enthusiasm this year."

I would laugh, but the humor is too grim, so I'll just smile slightly and shake my head.
author: Ben P.

description:
bring a bottle of Bitch Be Gone spray and use it on the friendly accommodating enthusiastic hostess. I've been a regular customer for 4 years and Miss Congeniality has yet to crack a smile . . . and I tip 18.5% just to clear that up.

my favs include beef & scrambled egg over rice (you will not find a heartier portion anywhere else, I promise you), sweet & sour chicken, and tomato beef chow mein. I usually take stuff to-go since I don't have much time to sit, and Shanghai has my order ready lickety split. I can come in here with less than a Hamilton and leave with a load of good food. great for poor man days when payday is beyond the horizon and you're sporting some new suede boots. ahem.

just the other day, Miss Bubbly actually said thank you. but bring that Bitch Be Gone just in case.
author: Prima D.

description: Shanghai China Restaurant of Mission Street, reminds me of all the other small chinese restaurant that, I have been to in the San Francisco Chinatown Area... On the reviews on yelp some people may have said that the food tasted really bad. That didnt happen to me when the first time, I went for lunch the food tasted pretty good, I didnt have any problems with this small chinese restaurant!!! Shanghai China Restaurant of the Mission Street Area to me is not that bad of a Chinese Restaurant and also this place is not that expensive!!!
author: William B.

description: now we're talking, cheap, fast and tasty Chinese food. It is all good.
author: Alexander M.

description:
Five Stars?  Damn right.
Why?
Their chicken wings....
Good lord.
Every Chinese restaurant I've been to has chicken wings.  
Chinese restaurants are a dime a dozen in The City.
The chicken wings here however, are so damn delightful I put them in a dead even tie with San Tungs.
Different style though.
These are trimmed perfectly and fried with cornstarch, garlic, green onion, and sprinkled "oh so lovingly" with monosodium glutamate.
Sound "typical"?
My friend,
Ya jus' don't know.
I only ever eat from here when I order delivery from work.
The wings though are worth traveling here for.
(Appetizer menu, not the "wet" garlic sauce)
author: Barry A.

description: I like there wor wanton soup. It's there best. Just beware of there delivery guy cause he demands his 20% tip. I'm not kidding.
author: Dalia C.

description:
A great place to grab lunch for under $10.

Lunch comes with egg drop soup (I really like it) and is always super-greasy and abundant.  

Don't expect a smile or and hint of human compassion from the waitresses, and you'll be just fine.
author: claire l.

description:
This little Chinese restaurant has a tag line "try once, like forever." And you know what, I did try it once and I've been going back for years. 

Its not gastronomic, its not a greasy spoon, its not an MSG bomb, its just a good Chinese restaurant that is best visited at lunch. 

The prices are inexpensive for how much they serve, the staff is neither friendly or mean, they just take your order and deliver your meal, they have good lunch specials and what else can be said but...

"Try Once, Like Forever!"
author: G R.

description:
Usually, I look at incredibly generic Chinese restaurant names involving any combination of {Imperial, Panda, Garden, Palace, China, Wok, Bamboo, etc} to mean I'm going to get good Chinese food that isn't trying to be anything fancy.  Usually, such places deliver on their promise of flavorful and oftentimes greasy fare.

So I ordered the Shrimp with Peanuts in Garlic Sauce and the Hunan Crispy Beef, along with Spring Rolls.  The beef was ok, and there was lots of it, but none of the food was good.  The spring rolls had no flavor whatsoever.  Both entrees were listed as being spicy, but that wasn't the case.

Maybe there are certain dishes to get, but unless some odd circumstances lead me back here, I won't be figuring out what those dishes are.
author: Joseph N.

description:
This place is great!  The food is served in generous amounts and its cheap, affordable and the restaurant looks pretty clean for the most part.  I always come here and order the $5 plates(because I'm broke, DUH!) like the fried rice and the chow fun.  You seriously can't be disappointed If you order from here.

Parking's kind of a pain in the ass.
author: Joyce C.

description:
Your standard cheap Chinese restaurant. Again, close to the civil service offices. Packed with government workers at lunch. One of those places that caters to the 30 minute lunch break with fast decent food and service. Three of us had lunch there for $20, with tip.

Try the Mongolian Beef Chow Mien, and anything with asparagus when they have it.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
they deliver.

almost all lunch items are less than $5.00

they have dishes named "bon-bon chicken, phoenix and dragon, strangely flavored chicken". how the heck can you NOT dig this spot??

i got the bon-bon chicken. chicken with sesame and peanut sauce over a bed of..... sliced cucumbers. with a side of rice. different, but good!

i haven't eaten inside, but i work 1/2 a block from here and drive by daily.
author: Ameer N.

description:
I was hungry at my internship, so I figured I'd order thru "Delivery.com" instead of walking 2 blocks to grab some Chinese take out.  That was MY mistake, because it took over an hour for my food to finally reach me.

Delivery aside, the food was surprisingly good.  The sweet & sour pork was better than most mediocre chinese places.  The potstickers were different but good.

The only real downside, I didn't get chopsticks with it.  Yeah, that should be a standard utensil.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
OK, another "Chinese" restaurant.  

The food is middle of the road.  Its not that its bad, its not that its good, it often is just there.

Best picks, war won-ton soup and shrimp with lobster sauce.

I get take out in a pinch when its late or I'm lazy.  Its cheap too.
author: Ken p.

description:
Tender greens (meaning bunch of steamed bok choi) chicken chow fun.  Tastes great, and it's a *very* generous portion for $6.00 even.  To go.

That's a lot of good things, so let's begin with five stars despite the total lack of atmosphere.  Can't buy a lot of atmosphere for six bucks.  So this review is going great, until we deduct one star for every piece of completely unchewable gristle in the meal.  Zing!!  Two stars left!

Next!
author: Eric O.

description: i have never been to the restaurant but have used their phone delivery service for the last five months. consistently great food at a very reasonable price delivered in a timely manner and always correct.  could not ask for a better take away/delivery in san francisco
author: ira l.

description: It's tempting to say that if you've seen one cheap Chinese SOMA lunch spot, you've seen em all.  But have you *tasted* them all?  While the menus (not to mention decor) in these parts lack the authentic idiosyncracies that make their outer-city brethren so much more unique, it would be a mistake to assume that the chefs-manship is equally uniform.  And on this count, Shanghai China comes out on the winning side of the spectrum, at least when it comes to their BBQ Pork Chow Mein.  It's nearly as much of a stomach-busting, wallet-saving comfort-food classic as the Kung Pao Tofu at equally nondescript and middle-of-nowhere Jade Cafe 2.
author: Wes M.

description: Only come here for lunch because its the only chinese restaurant in the area. The food is barely edible but thats it. The chow mein is really soggy and the wonton soup is just bad. The only plates i get are usually the beef with tofu or beef with oyster sauce over rice. Waitresses here are rude and unattentive. So eat here if you must but I would rather drive else where if I had more time on my lunch break.
author: anthony j.

description: I discovered an appetizer plate at this place that is so yummy.  I was eating there one day for lunch and saw this waitress walk by with a huge plate of food.  I stopped her and asked what it was, it was this Fried Chicken.  Try the Garlic Fried Chicken Wings.  If you like huge Fried Chicken Wings and like Garlic?  this is heaven. Its not spicy but you could request chili peppers.  The price was like $6 and I think I counted 14 huge wings.  And the Mongolian Beef Chow Fun $5 is still my all time favorite there. These two dishes could easily feed two people, and comes with soup.  Plentiful and delicious plus very resonable.
author: gordon g.

description: Very few vegetarian options, on the lunch menu anyway. I had the veggie fried rice, the serving was gigantic but the dish didn't have much flavor. It's cheap enough but there aren't many choices and its rather bland.
author: Cori W.

description:
The Good:
Price - Cheap for the immediate area
Portions - Plenty of food
Sizzling Rice Soup

The Decent:
House Special Fried Rice

The Bad:
Most of the food - Not very flavorful in general
author: Derk C.

description:
Food was good, the service was friendly and the prices are good.
A decent Chinese restaurant
author: Miha K.

description: Just ordered Sweet and Sour Pork Lunch Special for pick-up. They said it'd take 10min, but I think it only took like 5. I haven't had Sweet and Sour Pork in hella long, probably cuz it's usually soggy and has too much sauce, but their version is awesome. Maybe it's also cuz I'm hungry, but the pork was crisply fried and the sauce wasn't overwhelming, just enough. They even added a lil' egg roll. Cute.
author: Mary C.

description: I just ordered delivery from these guys. It was cheap and a LOT of food showed up. I paid $15 (including tip) and I have enough food for at least two more meals. The mu shu vegetable was very delicious - although more pancakes are needed for the huge amounts of filling they delivered. The veggie potstickers are also pretty good. And, the fortune cookies are fresh and crispy. All in all, I'm very pleased.
author: Corinne R.

description:
415-621-eight...one eight-eight
BBRRINNG BBRRINNG 
- Hallo?
Hi, I just ordered eggplant with garlic sauce
- Yeh
There was a piece of black plastic in the eggplant with garlic sauce
- Plastic?
Yeah, plastic
- What kind of plastic?
Hard plastic
- The bag plastic? We only have bags and plastic fork
No. Hard, dark plastic. In my-
- Part of the bag?
No. Inside my eggplant-
- Inside yo eggplant?
In! In the eggplant, in the box. I found a piece of hard plastic. I was eating the eggplant and I bit the hard plastic.
- Tomorrow, I give you the free eggplant next time, next time
Tomorrow?
- Yes, next time I give you free eggplant, next time
There won't be a next time.
- Okeh
There might be a next time if you can get me back my money
- Your money?
Yeah, I want to get my money back for the eggplant.
- Okeh. Next time I give you free eggplant.
No, I want my money.
- Okeh, bye.
Bye?
- Bye
I can't believe you're gonna hang-
author: Chris C.

description: I always come back to this place for lunch.  They deliver... and its fast.  When I work a busy day I don't have time to take an actual lunch so I order either the pork chops over rice ( a little dry, but its like how my Mom used to make it) or the MaPao Tofu.
author: Alice E.

description:
Shanghai China is the reason you should yelp something BEFORE ordering.  Randomly selecting a takeout menu from the pile is always a risk/reward proposition, and sadly, we spun the wheel and this time it landed on "bankrupt".
 
The Bad

1)  Order vegetables at your own risk.  The "Steamed Vegetarian Delight" was probably not steamed, but heated in a plastic cooking machine because you could distinctly catch the plastic after-taste.  

2)  The "Crispy Orange Chicken" was orange, but not crispy.  This is probably why they changed the name recently to "Orange-Flavored Chicken".

The Good

1)  The "Szechuan Style Bean Curd" was the only good surprise because it was what it was supposed to be.  If you're a vegetarian, go for the tofu.

2)  Quick, fast, & easy.  Delivers to your apartment door.

3)  4 Fortune Cookies!  If the numbers 2 13 32 33 39 43 win me a million dollars, I will prompty change the rating to 5*****'s!!
author: Jaren G.

description:
I was sick yesterday and this joint scratched me right where I itched. I had this damn cold that everyone and their Aunti Vera has and I was stuck at work. I was craving noodles and soup to help me make it through the shift.
Searched Delivery.com for Chinese and this spot turned up (plus their min. is only $10). Now, I wasn't expecting quality chow. I knew I would get MSG and probably too much oil. But the sickie in me wanted just that.
What I got did indeed have MSG and too much oil, but it was also quite flavorful. The chow mein was yummy and had larger chunks of chicken than I am used to getting in noodles. The hot and sour soup was so good that it was the first time in ages that I haven't had to add soy sauce or vinegar to it.
Just had the leftovers for dinner today and although the soup tasted even a little more oily, everything held up really well.
I will definately be ordering from Shanghai China again the next time I'm sick, maybe even sooner.
author: Maya S.

description: The portions were very generous and the service was very prompt the two times I ate there, but for they seem to like to pour in so much MSG that it is almost inedible.  It is always very busy during weekday lunch time for some reason.
author: Rick E.

description:
got a menu from these guys in the mail, so i went ahead and ordered food from them last night.  the food came really quickly, and was decent.  the prices were good as well.

i'll definitely order from them again
author: Steve S.

description: this is my favorite chinese place to order. they have the best shrimp chow mein that i like to add baby bok choy to, thee best. also their delight of three is amazing.
author: Star C.

description: Pretty ordinary Chinese fare, but it's cheap, fast, and quite tasty. The food tends to be much less greasy than other nearby Asian restaurants, and the generous portions will guarantee a trip to the storage room for a quick siesta before you head back to work. Great for takeout too!
author: Jim S.

description: had some "deliver" fried chicken drumstick from co-worker today. the size was a little scary since it was kinda huge like mutated chicken.. but overall.. taste was great. food tasted a lot better than eating at the restaurant. well.. at least it felt more clean
author: Doro C.

description:
I discovered Shanghai China when I worked in the neighborhood more than ten years ago and this quickly became my favorite lunch place.  I don't work near there anymore but I have been known to go out of my way to have lunch there!

I was happy to discover that they deliver to Nob Hill and have ordered food from there several times a year for the past ten years or so.  The food is always delivered quickly (30 - 40 minutes) and I've always been pleased with the flavors, generous portion sizes, quality of ingredients, and moderate prices.  

I've dined in a fair number of Chinese restaurants and this is definitely one of my favorites.  The Singapore-style noodles are great!
author: Jocelyn G.

description: I've only ordered the Chicken Fried Rice, which is decent (by fast-food standards).  I order to-go, and I leave a small tip (which I think is reasonable, since I'm picking up a $5 dish).  They will make me wait for an additional 10 minutes, even if I order 15 minutes prior to leaving my office to pick up.  I was going every other week, but I've been avoiding it for about 2 months because I haven't felt up to interacting with the staff there.
author: Menaka M.

description: It took an hour and a half to get my food after they said 40 minutes.  I ordered Sweet and Sour Chicken and bit into a bone!!! Need I say more!
author: K B.

description: Average Chinese American fare.  Good prices.  Small place.
author: Chris B.

description: Spicy curry chicken is alright. Sweet and sour sauce isn't. Fried rice was cool not great. If you need fast food and don't want a burger or taco, stop by here.
author: Robert F.

description: This place is good, but not great. I ordered from here because I'm studying for the CPA exam and they put a flier on the door downstairs. I ordered szechuan spicy beef, chicken chow mein, vegetarian fried rice and got the free potstickers with the coupon. Total was 20 bucks. It took only about 25-30 mins to arrive. The chow mein was the best part. The rest were just satisfying. The potsticks were definitely lacking though! Kind of doughy. So, got a craving for take out Chinese but don't want to move? This place will do it, but it ain't goin to be phenomenal. Oh ya the dishes are fairly plentiful with meat. Nice delivery guy. He gave me the coupon back.
author: Matt S.

description: Reliable, fast delivery.  Good taste and substantial portions for very little money.  We've been getting delivery from this place for years and no matter where we live, they deliver there -- Russian Hill and Pacific Heights.
author: Marc A.

description: quick, friendly service and pretty solid taste...but it's been about an hour and my stomach is not liking it : (  May try again, but really tired of stomach-ache-inducing Chinese...
author: Kat D.

description: The food here was all right, but nothing too amazing in price or quality. I wouldn't go out of my way to go back, but nor would I veto a suggestion to do so if I were in the neighborhood.
author: Adam E.

description: I decided to try this restaurant because i live close by. Also, I read a good review about the fried chicken wings which made me want to try this ploace even more. However, I was deeply disappointed. The chicken wing batter was made by a supermarket white pepper flavor and it was just too thickly fried. I did not enjoy the oily chicken wings with that thick batter. I also ordered the tofu with chicken and didn't enjoy that either. It was just too greasy and nothing special at all. The tofu again was too over fried then it was sauteed with a sauce. 2 dishes cost me a little over $15 so the price was not too bad. But I would not order again.
author: Sabrina F.

description: This place is disgusting. There's so much MSG and low-quality ingredients that I actually left my entree about 3/4 full. The soup was below average, and the fried rice was overcooked. The waiter said "oh you don't have big appetite today huh? Order too much food?" and I didn't want to say that I found everything to be absolutely terrible. I just left and wanted to forget I ever came here.
author: Hal C.

description: Good food, big portions, low price.  Authentic.  They really deserve four stars, but I'm giving them five stars to raise their rating.
author: SOMA lady S.

description: I work within a 10 min. walk from this restaurant and have been coming here for many years.  It's a solid, consistent place for lunch if you find what you like best and order that mostly.  On the odd occasion I've ventured away from my regular order I haven't  really liked it.  But that said, if you order what you enjoy it's a good value, service pretty quick and no frills.  It doesn't get overly crowded and I don't trip about the service (if it's dour or brusque) as long as I'm in and out promptly and food was good which it is almost always.  I've been going there for years and I know they recognize me by now but it's always the same almost indifference (although personally I've never had a problem with the service or staff), but I don't care cuz I'm not there to make friends.  If I got lousy inconsistent service and food, I wouldn't go back to any restaurant and I wouldn't expect anyone would want to, either.  So I don't and I do keep returning to this place because it's consistent and good in my book if nothing else.  I almost exclusively order the beef or shrimp scrambled egg over rice or over chow fun noodles...always great and sooo filling and done just right.  They include soup and an egg roll with lunch with almost too much rice and the price is good (nothing over $6).  The friends I go with consistently enjoy the sesame beef, eggplant with shrimp, shrimp with lobster sauce and tomato chow mein, and everyone's been happy with their choices.  This may not be the best Chinese restaurant but it's good if you find and stick with what you like.  For that, I give it 4 stars.
author: Mimi L.
